Name: The Long Road: A Postapocalyptic Novel (The New World Series)

ReviewList.Text: Can't begin to describe just how good these books are! I have read several post-apocolyptic books, and this series is by far some of the best reads! Can't wait for book 3!
This is one of the best books I've read in a long time.  It's amazing how so real it seems.  It makes you think of how you would have reacted.  Great Read can't wait for the next book.
My coworker and I are really into the survivalist books! This book was amazing and really told a good story. We are ecstatic for the 3rd book to come out and are counting down the days!

I read The end and couldn't wait for the next installment! The Long Road didn't disappoint! I began reading the book and couldn't put it down. I finished the book in no time. Only sorry that I have to wait for the next installment. G. Michael Hopf is a great writer and I feel like I understand the characters.

I have been reading this series since the first book. I suggest a potential reading search for "Hopf" figure out which books are in the correct order and start reading. You will not regret it. This series will become a classic in the genre. This is also one of the few series that I can not find fault with, at least not enough to bother remembering it.
a little disappointed because this book is apparently the second of a series, which i somehow didn't realize, so i haven't read it yet.
I love this trilogy!  I just finished the second book. I'm going to amazon right now to buy the third. I can't wait to find out what happens
I couldn't put it down.  What a great journey into the post apocalypse!  I am looking forward to the next book in this series!
Reading this book you can easily imagine that the horrors could happen today.  I am not a prepper, but this book gets you to thinking about being prepared.
Excellent read! It was hard to put down. I recommend it to anyone who would like to see one scenario when the power goes out. A very realistic scenario also!

I have thoroughly enjoyed this series.  Can't wait for the third volume to be released next month.  Reading these types of post-apocalyptic novels makes you wonder what would actually happen if the power ever went out for a long time.

Although this is the second book in the trilogy, the first two are totally self-contained as a complete story so you don't feel you've been left hanging in order to force you to buy the next book.  However, I wouldn't miss the third book in the trilogy and have already pre-ordered it in anticipation of its release.  Can hardly wait.  Each page gives you more to think about.  Everyone should read this series and consider being prepared in an emergency.
Looking forward to Sanctuary.  Really enjoyed the intensity of your descriptions during stressful moments for the characters.  You have won me over

Just finished G. Michael Hopf's sequel to "The End" and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The continuity between the first book and this one set the stage for another great effort by this emerging author.  My one complaint about the story was that there wasn't more of it.  The development of Sebastian's Odessy in parallel to that of his brother, and all of the other emergent spokes of the wheel leave you wondering how they will all connect at the end of "The Long Road" and beyond.  Anxiously awaiting the third book in the series, and the outcome to Gordon, Samantha, and the rest of my new found 'friends'.  A great follow up to the first book.  If a book can be rated by how tough it is to put it down, this one is well deserving of all five golden stars.
Really enjoyed this book and it is part of a three book series.  Just waiting now for the third book to be published.
This series is seriously addictive, with a plot that sounds plausible, making it all the more thrilling. Can't wait for the next book.

Believable story on how the democrats can ruin the world with socialism and greed. They live in a glass house making people pay for their ideas of equality with no oversight. Well after the world goes to hell in a hand basket, this book describes humanity at its lowest peak, along with the pictures of the true Americans that are forced to survive, as our 4 fathers did, fighting against tyranny. The book is serious, heart breaking, but only presents  one depiction of many into what the future holds for America and it's democratic socialists.
It's good enough that I can't wait for the next one to come out.  As this genre goes, it is one of the best I've read

Author kept my attention throughout the book, I read it within 2 days!  Characters and scenarios are so vivid, one almost a feels transported in their world.  I'm anticipating book 3 to be a rush like the last two.  Love this author!
Very entertaining keeps you hooked all the to the end can't wait for the next book. Keeps you on the edge of your chair.
I'm looking forward to the last installment in this trilogy. This book has set things up nicely for the ultimate finale.
Thought the premise of the book was very good.  The only reason that I did not rate it five stars was that  it was a bit slow in places.
Solidly written, it did not lag anywhere in the story. The "situation" was reasonable, if SHTF is reasonable, making it a good read.
I loved this book! Can't wait to finish reading this series. Interesting characters. Nothing too far out there. An interesting take on how things might pan out. Good read!

The book was a decent sequel to the first book "The End" though I found some of the plot sequences to be unrealistic and seemingly not in character with the main character Gordon who's supposed to be a trained (if retired) marine knowledgeable in the ways of warfare and mankind. Without spoiling the reader by giving anything away, let me just say, Gordon is supposed to be working his way with his family and others to his mountain retreat in Idaho for safety reasons. It befuddles me why he would jeopardize the whole trek by going off on a tangent mission scouting which results in serious and dire consequences and puts the trek to Idaho in such jeopardy. This was an unbelievable scenario to a story which began very well in the "The End" and continued with the" Long Road" until this detour by the author which made no sense and seemed unbelievably stupid in the extreme.

I read this book immediately after reading The End. The first one was so good I could not wait to continue the story. I loved the second one just as much as the first one. I cannot wait for the third one to come out. I found myself unable to put this book down. There were so many plot twists that I just had to keep reading until I was finished. This is by fare one of my favorite series to date and I hope there are many more books to come from Hopf!

This was a great sequel to the book that introduced me to this PA/WTSHTF genre. The Long Road picks up where The End leaves off, but don't take the title literally. Our protagonist doesn't make it far before he and his family face the realities of their journey to Idaho.. and those realities are devastating. I'm looking forward to the next installment of the journey.
Book 2 was better than book 1! Book 1 was great, so that's saying a lot. You have to read this series!
I thoroughly enjoyed this second book in "The New World Series". It is very entertaining and seems very true to how life would be like. I can only wait for the third installment.
This was the type of book that makes your heart rate race. It is an exciting story that you can imagine really happening.
Oh, my Heroes, Sebastian & Gordon.  A very exciting novel.  Just when I thought I knew what was going to happen next, it didn't. This book keeps the pages turning.  Best I've read in a while.
It is a very good book. Defined sad at times but keeps you wanting more. I am excited to read the next one.
Story is good. A lot of background that does not add to the story.  More attention to the  major characters.

Gritty and real, frustratingly not everyone gets out of this unscathed which is probably why I haven't been able to stop reading! By the end of book 1, I was curious enough to buy book 2. By the end of the second instalment, I am attached to the characters and frustrated that I can't launch straight into book 3! Signs of a great series. I particularly enjoy the fact I haven't always been able to predict the plot twists, a habit of mine that can ruin a good book if it's too simple!
absolutely fantastic book! one of the best series ever! it just kills me that i have to wait for next book.
I really enjoiyed this book in the series. Looking forward to the net one. Won't be here till spring next year.

This is book 2 in the series and was worth the wait.  The character development is excellent and very believable.  For instance, one of the characters, a girl who has been held in captivity and "abused" for weeks has changed from an ordinary apartment dweller who partied all the time to a vengeful woman filled with rage out for justice. Other characters are adapting and changing as society collapses around them and they learn more about themselves than they thought possible.  This book covers several different groups of people all pertinent to the overall story: The president and the military (what's left of it), a rogue Colonel and his ARG and what they are doing, the main character Gordon and his family, Gordons brother Sebastian & what he is going through, a drug kingpin and his plans for control and a group of psychopaths led by a religious nut job.  All are intertwined within the story and make for an excellent read.  I was a bit shaken when something happened in the story I didn't expect....can't say much here because I don't want to spoil the story...it shocked me as I read it but I realized this story is written IMO to be what could possibly happen when the lights go out. It has some hard moments in it and will make you want to jump in the story and help the good people win.  I started this book about a week ago and only get time to read at night and early in the morning. I finished it this morning and cannot wait until the next book....which according to this book will be available in the Spring of 2014.  This book series is excellent and will keep you engrossed with the characters as they struggle to survive.
I had no idea it could get this bad!  I read this a few weeks ago and am still shaken.  Read it!
This book was great.  Never thought about surviving something like this.  Great book, now my whole family is reading it.
Great series. Both of the books are page turners. I wish the third book was out right now. The first and second books I read without putting down... For long.

If read both books 1 and 2 and I have to say I'm hooked. Can't hardly wait for the next one. They really make a person stop and think about the real possibilities of an EMP. I would recommend this books to anyone. Not only because their a great read, but because of the real possibilities.
The great thing about this book is it's something that can really happen and makes you think, "what would you do if you were in their position?".

The first book, 'The End' was so good I could hardly wait to read the next one, this one, "The Long Road"; Oh my gosh, it is such a good book, but I hate that I have to wait until 2014 toad it!!! AWESOME READING!!!
The author is a good story teller.  It's hard to wait for the next book, oh well guess I'll have to.  The characters are well drawn, and the story fast paced.
I really got into this book. It seems possible that these things could happen. I`m disappointed that I have to wait till Spring for the next one. I wonder how many there will be?

Great book couldn't put it down, it's very fast paced and action packed highly recommend this book!  The author does a great job of delving into the humanity and inhumanity of mankind and is a great storyteller.
The second installment is just as good as the first in the series and now the long wait till next year starts.

After reading the first book I was looking forward to this second book and the continuing story  I was not disappointed!  Mr. Hopf's characters and story line are addictive.  I can't wait for the next book to see how everyone is doing.  I have been recommending these books to everyone! If you're a fan of apocalyptic events this book is one of the best.

I have always enjoyed reading since a young age, but for the past couple of years I had slowed down quite considerably. This series ignited my love for reading, and Mr. Hopf can definitely spin a tapestry of words to the point that you feel like you know the characters personally. A great read, with a lot of action and character dynamic.

G. Michael Hopf has done it again with "The Long Road" This book is the continuing saga of the events of an EMP disaster on America. The story is powerful, edge of your seat portrayals. Finished reading the book in 1-1/2days, just couldn't put it down. Another great book in my collection, right up there with "David Crawford", and "James Wesley Rawles".
This book was long awaited and his style of writing is so captivating, I lost slot of sleep not being able to put it down.
Every time I picked up this book I always read longer than I should have. I am glad I finished now I can get some sleep. Seriously, awesome book. Can't wait to read the next book.
Enjoyed this book. Fast reading. Can not wait for next book. Gives you a lot to think about. How would you handle something like this?

The intertwining of so many lives is usually confusing, but Mr. Hopf does a good job of keeping them in their own storyline. As a future history novel, it is all too plausible to ignore, prompting a check of my own abilities and limitations. Bravo Mr. HOPF!
If you enjoy reading end of the world scenario books this series is engaging and suspenseful. Protagonist is a good hero character, but equally flawed which makes him more interesting. Give it a try

Have been looking for a good series for quite some time and have found it!  This book will keep you reading long into the night!  A few editing errors but can be overlooked.  This book makes you think and want to prepare for bad times.

I am fully invested in these characters and what will happen to them.  I recommend this book to anyone who enjoys the post modern/post apocalyptic genre with or without the zombies.  And  I must say that humanity can be much scarier than zombies as these are people making conscious decisions on how to live in this new world.
A book written in real time, makes you really take a look around you and think about what you would or could do if and when this happens. It can happen

I just finished the sequel to THE END, called THE LONG ROAD. It was awsome. Full of action and very unpredictable. The characters have a lot of depth and you feel a kinship to them. Feels like you are part of their journey. If you like post apocolypse books you will love this one ! Can't wait for book 3 which is supposed to come out spring of 2014.

I am not one to leave many reviews but this is a must read. I really enjoyed the fast pace of the book as well as the multiple story lines. This is a subject that could happen now. There wasn't any sugar coating of the possible events or outcomes. Many times with this subject matter the main characters remain untouched and easily sail through the obstacles they face. Here realistic outcomes are the norm. I cant wait for the next book in the series. Good job to the author at keeping me on the edge of my seat and up late.

Just finished reading The Long Road. Amazing book!! It keeps you on the edge of your seat the entire time, and before you know it you have finished the book. I cannot wait for book 3 in the series. Until then I will try to find some similar books to pass the time until its release.

When I read the first novel I almost gave up reading it. I was so tired of how many times the characters said l love you. Near the end of the first book I was hooked. The "Long Road" was fast paced, thoughtful, and scary to think how fast society can crumble. I m looking forward to the next episode in this series.
A complete page turner.  Do I really have to wait til spring to see what happens?  A great story and well worth reading.
I love the story and the characters!  I like the tactical accuracy.  It's just awesome?  I just wish I could have book 3 now!
Well thought out series, many views makes for a lot of scenarios possible to come. About the only sure thing is that Hailey survives, to tell the tale.....keep em coming!!!
This author tells it like it is. It is refreshing...and scary to read about the realities facing people if things crumble. Lots of twists and turns.
This Book was a great read and kept me reading late into the night.  Great story lines and characters.  If you liked Book 1 you will love Book 2.
read the first in the series, then you will be hooked like i was. second book left me wanting more. will be looking forward to the third in the series.

Honestly, I bought the first book because of the price but I quickly fell hard for a great story and for me a new genre.  This book is a great continuation of the story started in "The End".  I can't wait to see how it all concludes in book three!  If this story doesn't make you stop and think, "could this happen today?", you aren't paying close attention to the realities of our world.

I enjoy reading post apocalytic novels and have read many over the years.  After reading the first book in this series, I was hooked and pre ordered The Long Road for my Kindle.  I thoroughly enjoyed it and will purchasing the next book in this series as soon as it is available.

This book, the continuation of The End, follows, the original storyline as well as any sequel I have ever read.  It is so well written that the reader feels compelled to come along for a fantastic ride.  Cannot wait until the next sequel arrives.
Brutal and gripping. Compelling reading and great characters, much better fun than zombie genre. Looking forward to next one. Word
This book (and series) has me so hooked I didn't want to put it down. I don't know how I will be able to wait until spring.  Great writer that I highly recommend.
I know the creative process takes time, but I am ready for the next book already.  I can't wait to see what happens when they get to Idaho.
RIVETING! Can't wait for the next  Book. It's a long time waiting till next spring. So please hurry up with the writing.

I could not wait for this book to come out so I pre ordered it.  Now I'm bummed that I read it so quickly.  I couldn't put it down.  I sure wish that the third book would be out sooner than spring 2014.

The second book in the story was just as good as the first. I love how the author ends these stories even though it frustrates me to be left hanging, wanting more story when there are no more words left. If you haven't read the first story "The End", I strongly recommend you read it before you read this one as it contains information you need to understand what is happening with the characters.

I couldn't put it down!!!! OMG how can we wait till spring for the next one??? This is a great book it really makes you think about what will happen to our country in the years to come. The characters are so believable I feel like I know them.  A must read.

This is one of the best series I have read. Very real, very graphic. I highly recommend it if you like post apocalyptic genre. The characters are real people with real problems. The story line is good and keeps your attention. I read the 1st book in a day and a half, the 2nd book in one night. Just couldent put it down. Had my kindle on the charger while I read.
I won't pretend that I know how to write a book let alone captivate an audience but this series has me staying up late just to turn the next page. Is it 2014 yet??
Can't wait for book three to come out next spring. I hate that you have to use a prescribed number of words for these reviews.
Moving story. Makes you wonder what if this does happen. Another good reason to Stay frosty waiting for the next book.

This book was amazing, just like the first. It was definitely more emotional than its predecessor. It is nice to have depth to your main characters and the book turns that I did not anticipate. I think we are, for the most part, used to happily ever afters and this series is more of a reality check if you will. I impatiently wait for the next installment.
I will read the next book and hope it is as good as the previous two have been. Recommended reading.

If you enjoy apocalyptic type stories the first book and now this one is a must read.  The story is told from several prospectives without confusing the reader.  The story is not predictable which i appreciate.  I especially liked the quotes at the beginning of each chapter and how they tied in to what was happening in the story.  I'm looking forward to the next book.

This was a very good read, building on what the first book brought to the table. Very satisfied with how the story progressed. I'd go into detail about the book, but I would possibly spoil it for many of you. All I have to say is that you have to read to first book to get the most out of the sequel. I look forward to the next book.

Okay, I started to read the second book and realized I forgot a lot of the story from the first book.  So I re-read the first book and then the second.  Now I feel like the interviewer at the end of the second book (buy the book and you'll see).  The reason I forgot most of the first book is that I'm reading a lot of the PAW (Post Apocalyptic World) fiction series out there.  I guess I'll have to find a lot more to read while I wait till next spring for book three. Good series, well worth the price compared to others.  Some may say it is gory, but that is how the world would be if... Thanks Mr. Hopf, get to work...

I have been waiting to read more of Gordon and Sebastian since I finished The End. I thoroughly enjoyed both The End and The Long Road, but was a little disappointed that after such a long wait, it was such a short read and that it covered only a small fraction of time. I wasn't crazy about some of the "bad guy" stuff, but i know it had to be in there. i thought there might have been maybe too many things in the mix that kept me away from both Gordon and Sebastian. After waiting so long to read up on them, it just seemed like too much of my time was being spent with tangent story lines. Not to say there is anything that is going to keep me from purchasing the next installment in the series. I just wish it would be released sooner than spring 2014. I recommend this series and will continue to follow Gordon and Sebastian's journey.

Read the 2nd book in the series in one session  over night. This book is leaps & bounds better than the 1st.  Far more plot, with unanticipated surprises. Finally, a few strong females, a far cry from the earlier novel. Few boring pauses and one exciting event after another. I enjoyed the read from beginning to end. I'm just sorry I have to wait almost a year to find out what happens.

The Long Road is another page turner from G. Michael Hopf.  I agree with other reviewers, it was really hard to put down. The action is pretty much non-stop.  This is one of the best end of the world series out there.  There is a really bright future ahead for this author.

I can only hope to face life in any situation with the determination and courage the characters are depicted with. You get caught up in the emotions and action easily. Can't wait for the 3rd book, I have developed a deep appreciation  for indie authors, thank you for your creativity and hard work.
The first book was outstanding. This one just never got off the ground. The story was slow and never really pulled you in.

Couldn't wait for the book to load to my Kindle.  I love the characters and the way you feel that you know them.  I have highly recommended this series to all my friends and I know of a few that have purchased the first book.  I cannot wait for the next book in the series.  Wonderfully written and it will keep you wanting more.

Original book was so good I actually felt the need to write to the author. I've read a lot in this genre and this is my favorite series. The editing can use a little work but I really don't think it detracts from the story. I highly recommend these books. The author also responded right away which only increases my fandom.

The "road trip" starts and ends outside of Barstow. The characters are flat and interchangeable. There is no ending. no resolution of anything, no goals achieved. The numerous side stories also go nowhere and seem to wander aimlessly. People making road trips after the power is out don't seem to worry about finding gas when the pumps won't work. This book is just to string you along to get you to buy his next book. I won't bother.

A good read.  The writer has spent some valuable time thinking about how the end of our technically reliant country would play out.  Also the things that might prove necessary that the average person is not prepared for nor ready to accept.

Great read and I can't wait for the next book!  The author is cruel leaving the ending of this book the way he did.  Spring 2014 it says in the back of the book.  Yup!  Cruel and unusual punishment for the love of a good book!
ahh, my new favorite author! Cant wait......okay its hard to wait for the next book. I am learning about being prepared as well as being entertained. Thanks!
this work will be among the best in this field for a long long time its a must read for sure try it you will like it

The Long Road: A Postapocalyptic Novel is a page turn. I enjoy this book. The characters and plots in this book will keep you wanting to read more. I found that the more I read the more I wanted to read. This line from the blrub is what will pull readers in to wanting to know more about this book “Only six weeks have passed since a super-EMP attack devastated the United States” This book it what the blurb says. The character, big or small roles, all play a part in making the story and keeped me hook. I don’t want to get into the plot and spill the beans but it is one that will keep you guessing. This a read for anyone looking for an adventure page turn story.
Well written and overall very plausible.  I'm reading the second book in the series now.

Since this a continuation of the first book, I have nothing to add to that I did not see in this book.  It IS turning more into a "societal building" story and that is kind of fun.  There continue to be things that happen just to point out that humanity is basically nothing but a bunch of animals.  You can tell the bad guys by their general lack of dental hygiene in the description just before the fighting breaks out.  But, hey I paid good money for it and it does deliver an entertaining couple of hours.  Cheaper than renting a video (and the exact same story you usually see in the  "Straight to DVD" releases.)

I enjoyed the book, and it does make one think more on the "what ifs". As with most books I've read and reviewed, some tend to delve too much on gear, and what a "rambo" type person is the hero in the book. This book does deal with the faults and problems that can do happen to us frail humans. The author does take into account that the "hero" is a better than normal person with some training and prepardness, and that does make the story line move better. An enjoyable book, and does give one ideas and thoughts as to "what if this does happen"!

I really liked this one.  I think that there are three in the series right now, and this was number two.  Wonderful story about a man and his family, his brother, the country's government and what happens to them all when there is a nuclear exchange and there isn't a lot left to help you survive.  An excellent read and I won't spoil anything by going into detail.  Read it.  You won't be sorry and don't forget the first book, nor the third as well.  I'm waiting for the fourth one.  Coming soon.  This is an edge of your seat experience that grips tight and won't let go.
Micheal is a fantastic writer.i love this series.It gets better and better.
Love this author.  Love this story.  A head above most survival stories.

From the very first line in the book, You get sucked into a world that makes you feel like you are there with the characters experiencing everything that they go through. I personally can't wait for the third book. I'm new to the hobby of reading but after this series I'm so glad that I started reading. The auther of this series is a genius with his story telling and makes each character feel like a real person. I highly recommend this book and series to anyone who is looking for a great story.
An excellent effort by this author, I really enjoyed the book
I was very disappointed in this book. More than half was just a repeat from the first book. I hope the final book is better.

A story that takes you further than any I've read before. I've now read both of these and they are both stories that have made me think about them long after the book is put away. There is little heroism or glory in Hopf's post apocalyptic world, very gritty and I hope never real. Worth the read, just hang on to your hat (and your family).
Good characters and stories that come together well.  All sides and failures of human beings have light shone upon them.
I absolutely love this series. The story is gripping and its hard to put down. I cannot wait for the next book.
Very good read. So many things are hanging in the balance. I can't wait for book 3 in this awesome series

I really liked this book because I got lost in it and felt I was right there with the characters... I didn't even realize I was at the end of the book... I disliked that the book was over and I have to wait for the next one to come out.
I really should wait until a whole series is done before starting to read it. Now I must wait. Very good read. I enjoyed both so far and can't wait until the next one.
Brilliant plot, plenty of action and very believable characters and scenarios.  Can't wait for next in series which I think should be out before Christmas as 2014 seems so far away!!!!!!!!!!!

After reading the first book in the series I couldn't wait to read this one and it didn't disappoint!  Even better than the first, it kept me wanting more.  I am anxiously awaiting the next installment!

You suck! I thoroughly enjoyed both books and now I have to wait until next year?! Oh well I look forward to reading it in the spring. Great book for all those interested in reading it. Two thumbs up!

Good followup to the first book...was an enjoyable read.  A few errors here and there but nothing that takes away from the storyline.  The only thing that bugged me to no end was the year is reverted back to 2014 instead of 2015 in all the chapter titles....

Some of the best dystopian fiction I have read focuses on character development, making you feel like you know the people you are reading about. G. Michael Hopf succeeds and allows you to feel the pain his characters are feeling. Makes for a much better story.
I didn't want the story to end. The story line has me glued to my chair. I like the way the author goes back and forth between the main characters. I am ready for the next one in the series.
2nd book to 'the End' and so much going on that it keeps the reader (or did me) on the edge of my seat!  The world has to to hell and it's every man for himself!.....
I enjoyed reading all three books. Could not put them down. It should be made into a movie. Can't wait for #4 book

Wow! Talk about intense. I couldn't put my book down for the last hundred or so pages. Without dropping spoilers, let me say that this book leaves the reader wanting more of Haley's story. Definitely for adult readers; plenty of blood (its a novel of survival). I'm glad I have a copy of SANCTUARY, the sequel to this book. I'm ready for Hopf's next book in the series.

Mr. Hoph has written a series that will be talked about for years to come. Is his series made of sunshine and rainbows? Nope. Is there going to be a happy ending? Not sure, but most likely not, this is a series where nobody is safe. Hopf, paints an amazing picture for his readers, that when everything goes black, what will you do to make sure your family will survive?
It was real because some good people died as well. God help us if this becomes reality. We are too dependent on electricity, oil and government.
had me setting, waiting for the next one to come out! if you are into the post apocalyptic this is a must.
These books grab hold of you and keep you on the edge of your seat. I can't wait to read the last book.

A very good second installment of the series. If you liked the first book this one will not disappoint. Hopf keeps the story moving forward setting up at least two major factions fighting for control of the country along with individual character development. Plus he's not afraid to shake things up with the death of a central character. A touch of "realism" keeps the reader guessing.

The second novel in the New World Series has intensified. Every decision the characters make have repercussions. Not a single moment in this book was cliche. Gripping moments and new characters make this novel stand out.
I really liked this author. Im gonna buy his other books when they come out. Great story and worthwhile read.

Naturally, you will have read the first book as this references many previously documented events without specifically going over the ground again. The pace is good and I received quite a surprise when I reached the ento find another one is in the works to complete the story. Only problem is it's out yet!!!
I enjoyed reading this book and can't wait for the last book of the series. I kept me wanting to continue reading to find out what happened next.
great.book,,.lots.of."action"; good character development. I can't wait for book 3. lots of situations to think about.  If you aren't a survivalist you may not like it.q
Love this book.  Author grabs your attention and does not let go.  The series is awesome.  I can not wait for the next book.
This was an okay story line, have read other books with stronger story lines and grittier details, but it kept my interest.
Such a good book. I can't wait for the next one. I wonder how many there will be our if he will start something new.

No zombies in this author's version of a post apocalyptic world, but the possibility of an EMP changing the world as we know it made me think its not so far from reality..... I better start stocking up on batteries.  The second installment was as good as the first and I am anxious for the third book release.
I would say that this is on par with the better postapocalyptic novels out there.  Good story, well written and interesting characters.  If your a fan of SHTF fiction, you will like The Long Road.
Another fantastic novel in "The New World" universe. I am eagerly awaiting the sequel, and hope it is released soon.

a good series.  It had been a while since I had read the first in the series so it took me a while to remember where I was in the story.  I wish the author had done a short recap at the beginning.  The stories of this genre all start running together after a while.  I will keep reading the series as it comes out.
The author pulls you into the story and, unlike so many today, his use of proper grammar and spelling was great. The lack of that can ruin a book for me.
Couldn't put this book down because of wanting to find out what was going to happen next. This was a believable, brutal look at what could happen if an apocalypse were to occur.
I can't wait for the next book. number 1 was great number 2 was even better. what's next by this brilliant author!?
Great story....good plot twists...sad heartbreaking tale....can't wait for next chapter..the multiple storylines are believable, the characters are very earthy and I feel like I know them....

Well just like the first book of the series, I LOVED IT! I stayed up way too late at night reading it! I figured, "hell 3 hrs of sleep I sufficient..." I hated that hunter died(and the way he did), but I understand that it creates a whole other "adventure" in the book. Cannot wait for the the third book to come out! G. Michael Hoph, I love your work sir! Keep it comin!

Look, I read this book just like the first one all in one sitting. The author has a real flare for grabbing you and pulling you into the story. There were also parts of this book that made me want to say 'that's it, I can't read this anymore'. I genuinely felt the pain several of the characters went through, and it was not a peasant experience in that regard. All in all great work, but be warned it is intense.
not quite as into rallying as the first books, but I finished anxious for the next one so I'm happy.

I like a story with characters I can identify with. They are not perfect. I like that. They make the same mistake most of us would. I liked the story like because it was diifferent and I cant wait to see what happens next.
Love this series and I can't wait for the next one. Very believable and scary that this could really happen.
I think I have found a new author to add to my "favorites".  Will have to look for more of his work
If you liked the first book you will like this one also.  Good plot twists, unfortunately -did not get through enough of the story

This is a good sequel to “The End”. It continued with the original story and characters. The ending was bit abrupt and I didn’t enjoy it as much as the first book. Still, if a third book comes out I will most likely read it.
Book flows in a very understandable way.  It kept my interest all the way through.  In fact this was the second time i read it.  Can't wait for the next book!
What an adventure.  It had me from the start.  I can't wait until  Michael Hopf brings us back to his apocalyptic world.

Postapocalyptic fictions at it's finest!  Mr. Hopf has me addicted to his books.  I love this genre and have reads tons of books, his are way more realistic & NO ZOMBIE crap!  Highly recommend this book to all my friends and family and they are hooked also!
Hard to put down!  First time I read anything written by the author.  Well done.  Look forward to reading other books by him.

There is so much detail and excitement and emotions within this 2nd book i get lost in the book.  The only bad news is now i have to wait until the spring for the next book.  I think if you are over 30 then you will be more emotional over the events.  If you are younger you probably will think a lot of the events are exciting and pretty cool.  Enjoy this great read and so excited there will be at least a 3rd book.

A lot of times, you are let down by the second book in a series. Not here!! I can honestly say that this book was just as exciting as the first book in the series. There was some great twists and turns and I can't wait until April for book three. Keep them coming G. Michael Hopf.

The structure of this book has often been used before.  The story is compartmentalized moving from one group to the next maintaining interest in each group.  After the nuclear bomb destroys all power in the US Gordon takes charge of the resdents of his lavish community organizing everyone to survive.  Burt there are problems to beset them.  Colonel Baronne, a naval marine disobeys direct orders to aid in the recovery of the East and insad takes his ship west to find and rescue the families of his men.  The President of the United must find a way to save his county.  Sebastian, Gordon's brother, desperately searches for his only family.  All of these men face incredible odds.  These are their stories.  And they are riveting.

I enjoyed the book, it was well written. The book leaves you wanting more. Michael demonstrates that he is very knowledgeable regarding much of the subject matter covered in this story. Though the book is fiction it is not unfeasible that the possibility of something similar happening.
Loved the story, the characters were compelling and the writing was well done. All in all, it is worth a few bucks and is a good book to buy.
I can't wait for the next installment! This series is so riveting, really glad I stumbled across this new author.
This is a great book.  It keeps you on the edge of your seat and makes you wonder if you are ready for whatever catastrophe lies ahead.
Good book. It was an easy read. A book u dont want to put down when tou start reading it
Excellent book for those who like the apocalypse theme. Full of emotions and action. Highly recommend it! Can't wait for the third book...

I really enjoyed this book. It's the second in a series with a third on the way. The first book was really good, too,but the writing has improved with the second, in my opinion. I look forward to the third and whatever else this author may produce.
No Zombies in this book. Well written, good characterisations. Highly recommended read. Looking forward to more of the continuing story.
I was riveted, could not put  it down.  So much pain and sorrow but so much love as well......WOW...I  am so waiting for the sequel.
Can't wait for the next book!  Story flows smoothly and keeps you engrossed in what will happen next.  Looking forward to the sequel.
Great series so far. It's not another zombie book, this one is intense start to finish. Can't wait for the next book to be released.
Fast paced, cohesive and compelling.  Great characters and not very predictable which adds to the story.  Looking forward to next year's release of the third book in the series.
Good book can't wait for the next he shows the necessity of preparation but needs to work on the right equipment
Couldn't put it down once started. Keeps the action going and suckes  you in for the next book. Can't wait.
This book and the first book of this series kept me turning page after page. I can picture the world like this after an EMP.  Can't wait for the third book.
The author wrote a wonderful story that was at times implausible but always entertaining. He has mastered the art of surprise and uses it well. Kudos
This book was riviting....couldn't put it down...can't wait for the next one to come out to continue the story of Hunter
Absolutely riveting from start to finish.  I cannot wait for the third book!!!  Definitely the best indie book purchase I have ever made!!!

This story started a bit slow in the 1st book. Which I gave a 4rating. But this book is power packed great action, great character development. I highly recommend this series and can't wait for the next book.
I enjoy reading reasonably well crafted stories, this is one. I jumped into book two, having not read book one. Still enjoyed it very much. I read about 4 books a week.
Often times the second in a series especially the genre of distopian novels is disappointing , but NOT The Long Road. Gripping read, I couldn't put it down. Can't wait for the next book!
Good book, worth the read, I skip over a lot of the chapters containing the presidents wife, just not a character to waster chapters on.  All in all a decent read.
Not as long as I had hoped. Still, I am looking forward to the publication of the next book in the series.
It was hard to put the book down. The language was a bit to rough for my taste. Good read.
Kept my interest the entire time right up to the end when I found out this was going to be a trilogy. Guess I'll have to wait until next year to find out how all of it ends up!
A fitting and exciting sequel to THE END.  The character development and plot twists keep the pages turning well past my normal bedtime.  I am anxiously awaiting the next book in this series.

The continuity of the characters was mostly believable. At first I felt that the author was overextending the story lines. It was a little overwhelming at the start of Long Road, but the author really did a good job of pulling it all together and fleshing out all the important characters. Overall I couldn't stop reading it. I ended up caring about the characters enough to keep reading to find out what happened to them.  I look forward to the next book in the series.
Looking foward to book number 3. The story seems like a distant reality, but makes you wonder if it isn't a possible cenario for world caos.
this book just draws you in and wont let you go. it makes you wonder if this is what the world is coming to for sure. the book is written great and would recommend it to anyone
This was a great sequel to the original. This book flows very well and sucks you right in. Can't wait for the third book.
Really enjoyed this book, sat up all night reading it! Ready for the next one, dont know if I can wait.

Story was believable and probably exactly what things will be like under those particular circumstances. The characters portrayed real people from all walks of life. It was hard to put down once I started reading it.

A thoroughly frightening scenario of how dependent we are on our "necessities". This series will keep you on the edge of your seat not knowing what will come next or how will they survive. It's extremely hard waiting for the next installment.

I really enjoyeded this book, in fact I finished it in three days which is unusual for me.  The situations that the group found itself in seemed very plausable and yet they they were not predictable ... there were surprises all along the way.  I got right into the sequal and loved it too.
Well done would be a great movie  very realistic and easy to follow  interestingly points out how we relive our decisions
A good read which gets you to contemplating what yesterday was and what tomorrow might bring. The story builds and pulls you as every good book should.  Kudos to Mr Hopf!
Awesome read! Hurry up book 3! This story sucks you in and leaves you begging for more. I love survival stories.
This was the second book in the series and it was just as good as the first I can't wait for the next book to come out so many questions need to be answered
Fills in right where the first left off without too much of revisiting the first book. Same story line,well formed and well written. Highly recommend!
Continuely on the edge of my seat. A great follow up to the first book! Well written, descriptive, I felt like I was there. Completely left me reeling for a third, please hurry!!!!

The second installment to "the new world" series following "The End" had me from the beginning. I have enjoyed reading both of books and look forward to the next. It has only been a year since I have gotten into apocalyptic type books, but so far this one is near the top in non-zombie types. I think Hopf nails it when it comes down to the breakdown of society. Also working in the nuclear industry, he doesn't forget what will truly happen to all of the plants nation/world wide as many books do. Here in the West we will be ok, but East of the Mississippi they are hosed.
Not boring and lots of action. It was a good read and looking forward to next one. recommend to anyone who likes end of the world novels.
Picks up where the first one ends. Leaves you wanting more. Can't wait for the next one to come out in the spring. Wish the author would write faster.
With all the crazy stuff going on in the world, I thought this an appropriate book.  LOVED the first one!  LOVED the second one!!  Looking forward to the third one!!!
The New World series is awesome! I can't wait for book 3 to be ready!! I love this genre and G. Michael Hopf does a great job with his detail and characters.  Great read!!!
I enjoy reading this type of book and this series has been hard to put down.  I read book one and two in two days. Highly recommend.

These last two books of this series did not grow cold on the table, I was not able to put them down.  The story is factual and accurate with the landmarks and locations mentioned.  Many Kudos to the author for absolutely wonderful and gripping reading.
Excellent story. Fun and exciting. If you're into this kind of story. Good thing I am. I would suggest reading this series.
The long road was a good read but disappointing in some of the characters outcomes. There could have been more completion in this part of the series.

This is a good series.  Each installment has left me gritting my teeth wanting more.  It's a horribly wonderful story about life, death, the struggle for survival and the resilience of the human spirit.  It will bring tears to your eyes and wrenching anger to your gut at the seemingly endless capacity some people have for inflicting pain and perpetrating evil.  I hate that I have to wait till Spring next year for the next book!!

When I finished reading The End I couldn't wait to get my hands on the sequel. It was a long wait but well worth it. The Long Road is even better than The End. More, stronger characters emerge and their interwoven story lines create a colorful tapestry of a world devastated by an EMP. Some people devolve into savagery, others try to keep the candle of civility alive in a world filled with pain, loss, anger and greed. It will be a cruel few months waiting for episode three!.
Can't wait for the next installment in the series. Coming from a long line of Navy and Marine heritage, this book adds an interesting element and discussion to any post apocalyptic conversation.
Addictive! The characters are becoming, the story is very entertaining and I couldn't wait to get back to reading more!
keeps your interest and is a very good story line I would recommend this book to everyone and the whole series is great
Decent.  I enjoyed it.  I will read the next one in the spring.  And to see the country down though.
EXCELLENT READ. I CAN'T WAIT FOR THE NEXT ONE. I HOPE I GET NOTIFIED. I do recommend both books so far.
Excellent writing. I felt like I was there with Gordon. Lots of action. A must read for this type of genre. Can't wait for the next book. G.Michael Hopf has what it takes to make it as a writer.
Great sequel to the first book. I enjoyed very word. I am looking forward to the 3rd book of the series. If it can keep up with the first 2, should be a killer!
This book was so intriguing. I was on the edge of my seat the whole time. I'm so upset how it ended though. I want more. I can't wait until spring.

Book 2 of the new world series picks up right where the first left off. The characters are likable and you find yourself rooting for some more than others. It felt like it got a little bogged down trying to follow so many story lines at once. I am looking forward to book 3 and beyond.
Cant wait for the next book in the series! Awesome book and a great read, keeps you reading, couldnt put it down!
So good!  I don't want to wait until next year for the next installment!  The second book is just as riveting as the first.
Great book, continuing from the first in the series. Would recommend. Very eager for the next one to be released.
These books are awesome! For post apocalyptic work this is some of the best I have ever read. The story along with great research done by Hopf make this a amazing read.

So many twist and turns - so many plots and subplots! The story line is very good with lots of action. Sad - happy and ... You will think things are working out and coming together and then something bad happens - a lot of surprises. Heroes and villains - some you will want to do bad things to. I highly recommend this series
This is a ok series the characters believable and the story is interesting. One thing that I do not care for is the different plots there just seem to be to many.

I first book had me hooked. I couldn't wait for the sequel. I was a little disappointed by the sluggishness of the second. I didn't think the characters were as well developed. All in all I did enjoy the story line, though. I would recommend this book this series to friends and family.
Love the story line but hate waiting for the next book, if I knew that the serious is not complete I would have not bought the book.
I really enjoy Hopf's writing and the plot is about a realistic as you can get for a post-apocalyptic novel. Can't wait for the next installment!
Realistic characters in a future that's believable.  Will be waiting for the next chapter of our very possible future.  Love the strength of the women in this series.

I just finished reading the long road today and left me drooling for book number three. Unfourtunatly I just read it will be realeased until mid next year. Great series. The Enemies foreign and domestic trilory is also a good read to keep up entertained 'til next year. Congrats to the author...........

I absolutely love these books! I could not put them down! The only bad thing is I have to wait a year to see what happens! God I hate that! I really like how the author has the child in the story explain the storyline as an adult. Excellent book!
This was a great read of what could happen today !  I suggest everyone read this book.  I can't wait for book 3
This is definately a must read series. Suitably frightening and utterly realistic. Spring 2014 can't come fast enough for the next book release!

The characters are so well developed you really feel you know them. The story is compelling and heart wrenching. The narrative is outstanding. I had trouble putting down this book. I cannot believe I have to wait until spring 2014 for the next novel.
Thought it was a great book. Very believable and look forward to reading the next book. I hope you will continue to write more books like these.

The Long Road, the second book in Michael Hopf's The New World series, continues the story of Gordon, Barone, Pablo, Sebastian, and Cruz - Conner.  Told from the mouth of Haley during an interview that takes place in a more settled future, the stories are exciting and compelling - there are some surprises. Like the book one, at the end Hopf leaves us hanging with a tease or two. I look forward to the release of book 3 in spring 2014...

This kept me wanting more and on the edge of my seat the whole time. The best part is that it's so realistic, no ones safe. Only warning is its hard to put down especially from mid way through to the last page.

I was waiting for this book to come out and answer some questions about the first book, and now I'm going to be impatiently waiting for the third book.  This was a great read and compelling storyline.  The series is taking off and and can only get better!

The 2nd book is a great well written book but when I bought it I thought it would answer all the adventures and end the series. I hope the next book is a final book and is as exciting and fun to read as the 1st 2 books. I would advise every prepper to read this book and anyone who is interested in what would happen in our country if multiple hydrogen bombs took out our Federal government.

Continuing story of a family and friends from San Diego community in post apocalyptic (EMP attack) United States.  Many excellent characters.  Some of the "good guys" die in this struggle so be prepared.

The second book adds more diversity to an already difficult situation. The characters introduced and the topics as they play out do leave you with wanting more on how this challenging journey and transition ends.
Great story line. Very believable. I will definitely get the third book in the series...if an EMP doesn't get us all first!

I can't believe how people are. The world will be KILL or be killed. Every book I have read where people turn on each other. It also sad how a little boy died. Where good book. Read it u see the world different

The title "The Long Road" would make one think it was all about the journey to Idaho, but they really never even got out of California. I was a little disappointed by that but still thought it was a good story and it kept my attention enough for me to read it in a single sitting.  I am looking forward to reading book #3 in the series.
First book was great. And so is this sequel. Just wish there were more pages to read. Great read for me
A great follow up to " The End". Cannot wait for the next in the series. Leaves you wanting more of the story.
Quick read.  Ready for book 3!  Very well thought out.  Enjoyed it very much. Need more word...amazon needs shorter reviews
One of the better SHTF books I have read. I am excited about the rest of the series coming out.

I have to wait until Spring 2014 for the sequel !? What if an EMP takes out my Kindle!? Great read! This story has a lot of momentum, good character development and story line. Can't wait till next year's release. To the author, keep them comin and stay frosty!

On the edge of my seat, just like the first book! Can't believe I have to wait til spring the more of the story:( the only constructive criticism I have for the author is that I found it a little hard to keep track of the players in this book and who was in which group where. Just when I was finally comfortable with the characters, the story was over.

Many authors have great first books but the 2nd leave much to be desired.. this is NOT the case... just enough ups and downs and mini stories going to keep your mind fully involved, then you reach the end, and like a junkie, you NEED the next book...worth every cent... will prob buy a hard copy after the 3rd book comes out!
I read a ton of post apocalyptic books. Really enjoying following the story. Hoping for an early release of the next one.
I  really enjoyed the book I couldn't put it down. I am really  looking forward to the continuation of the story.
Good read as was book one cannot wait for third book.  Good take on the end of the world scenario

Fantastic read.  I am a big fan of post-apocalyptic fiction & this series has it all!  The second book was as good as the first & brings the reader even farther into the devastating world that is now left. Can't wait for the next installment.
A good follow up to an awesome first novel.  The action is intense and my only complaint is that it was too short, but to be fair I just didn't want it to end
A TOUGH READ...BUT ALL TOO POSSIBLE, I FEAR

I read the first book and liked it well enough that I purchased this second book and plan on purchasing the next one as well.  They have been good solid reads so far but I do wish that the scenes had been fleshed out a bit more than they were.  The book had a good flow to it and was enjoyable to read.
Gets your attention fast and keeps it!
Great read for all you PREPPERS...

A story that really makes you ponder....  This has prompted me to make a POA for a similar event.  Nothing to drastic but always good to think what your 1st steps would be in a catastrophic situation..  Great start to the series.  Hooked so far.

Hopf is on a roll here, nicely done, captivating, I liked this one better then the first really looking forward the the third.  I really like the narrator in the audio version, he continues to do a nice job with scenario changes and role play.

A very good and entertaining sequel to The End. The characters are well written and entertaining. Gordon is one of the main characters and while a disaster magnet, you do start to care about his and his family's survival.
Can't wait to start book 3
I really liked this series, so far anyway. I was able to read the first 2 books back to back and I didn't stop until I finished both in record time. Will keep going with the series.
The author does a incredible job in this novel.  His detail to people and events are unsurpassed.  I feel like these people  are family.  Cannot wait to read the third novel.
These are page turners, couldn't put them down. The plot is extremely realistic and compelling. Can't wait for the third!!
I liked this one better than the first book. I could not put this one down. Lots of twist and turns. Good follow up from book 1. I am looking forward to the next book.
Couldn't put it down!  It was intriguing, heart pumping, heart wrenching and captivating.  This ended up being a very quick read, as I couldn't put it down.
This book is outstanding if you are a Marine or Pryor military you got to read. It's a very close depiction of what could happen if we were hit by a EMP!!
The first book in a trilogy, this postapocalyptic story provides another take on how people must adjust to a different life style.
I like the story but it seems to be splintering at a high rate, without good explanation...am on to the 3rd book nonetheless
Pleasant read, but it tended to drag a bit while they were in the desert. Still, worth reading just to follow the series!
Love the series
I enjoyed the story but parts of the narrative could be improved. I will buy the third in the series when it comes out.
Loved book 1. Really loved book 2. Continues on well. A great series. Definitely worthy of your time. Enjoy.
A poorly written, formulaic, tired rehash of a bleak topic, which doesn't really even have the decency not to look too much like a z-grade movie script. Don't waste your money
This continues the journey of The End and its also going to the library a good read.
Love this series.  Very well written.  Can't wait for the next one in June.
Good book, but not one of the best in this how the future is coming story.
I liked it, but is their yet another book. To many unanswered questions.
i can't wait for the next book in the series  I couldn't put it down
The book was really slow and the ending was incomplete. I think the author could have done so much more with this story.

I feel like I am forced to read through several sub-plots and even micro stories within them to get back to my main character and story of him and his family.  I really don't care about what makes the sub-characters tick.  It's as if the author bought a mind-mapping app that he could create multiple branches and sub-branches off of and ran wild with it.  While I like mind mapping for thought development and demonstrating on a whiteboard to a group of students, it does not work for me while reading.  For that matter I think television and movies that tell multiple stores suck also.  It ends up a jumbled mess.  Yes, the author and/or director know what is being presented, but then again, in their mind and in writing they have the the script or draft.  I bought this book because I wanted to follow one character and his family in their story of survival.  What I got was a book that follows not just that story, but another family member, which is interesting, but stories of several other sub-characters and their families that are not interesting.  Tell their stories in separate books!
I liked the realistic story lines that are interwoven throughout.  The story tells it like it would be in this type of situation.
This has been one of my favorite reads in a long time. I highly recommend this book to anyone who enjoy a good story.
Too short but I had a difficult time putting it down.  Well written book, lots of action.  Can't wait for the next book
I enjoyed the 2nd book but not as gripping as the first. I do really enjoy the series and cannot wait for the next one to come out in spring.
I get so caught up in this story and these characters. Great quick read, only wish I could read through to the end right away.

This book kept me turning pages long after I should have put it done and slept. Characters are well written and you care about them right off. Both books in this series are strong and make you want to read the next.
Another great read, but please FIRE YOUR EDITOR! So many mistakes!
this is a good series of books and a good yarn into the bargain
Excellent author.  Very good pre and post-acopolytic story.
Glad had it in stock thank you it help me out in many ways.
excellent book....like the details, characters. enjoyed it
Like reading these kinds of books.This one is good also.
Start with the first book. Very entertaining series.
A little short for a novel but well written.
A good read and a welcome distraction.
Great Read... enjoyed every bit of it
Not quite as human as the first book.
this is an amazing series of books.

If I don't like a book I just don't give a review but people who love post-apocalyptic stories should be warned. Should have done that in the first review for The End.  In this book, the characters are getting worse instead of better or even reasonable.  Hardly anyone ever has a reasonable, thought-out motive for whatever they do - they just do it & what happens, happens.  In The End I thought that it would probably get better, at least we would learn more about the characters & their reasons for being "weird."  Well, it didn't happen!  The women are given a bit more accountability but they are turning out just as ridiculous as the men.  The men are all psychotic.  The women were not worth much in The End, & in this book they are becoming as strange as the men.  Gordon is totally to blame for Hunter.  I realize that such a situation would rattle a person & it would be hard to know what to do.  But please - not this bad!!  Making Hunter (8 years old) feel like both Samantha & Haley are his responsibility is just ridiculous - no 8 year old should have that put on him.  The attacks, the imprisonment & all the rest are becoming just too much.  I have already ordered the next book, Sanctuary & I wish I had not done that.  I won't order the 4th book unless the third one has some major changes in it.
Fair effort, but Hopf needs a co-writer or a heavy handed editor. I was a little more kind on the first novel but this just fell apart on too many levels.
The whole series has been great!
Great read.  Hard to put down.
The long road does not disappoint.  Like book 1 it is filled with amazing characters and tons of action.  I can't wait for book 3 to come out
Good post apocalyptic read!
read this series for sure
Awesome book,good read.
A very good series.
I am a fan of the post apocalyptic genre but this book is just not good. It has a very boring story line, poor character development, and I had to skip through the dialog to get to the end.

Poor Gordon and his family.  They can't seem to catch a break.  The story line in the New World series is awesome to me.  I very much like that Hopf's protagonist isn't the typical wins at every situation he is put in, in record time.  Gordon is really a very human character who is presented some tough decisions in order to guarantee the survival of his family and those that are following him. I gave it 4 stars because there were some mistakes and words that were left out that kind of interrupted my reading, but still a great story.  Looking forward to the next installment.
Great book!!!!
I enjoyed it!
Good reading
Good series
great book

3 stars because there's more of a story to follow than book one, but the book lacks detail(the what, why, how). There's no sign of prep work by subjects in book. Everybody scrambles to make the best of it. No follow up on where the nuke come from, why targets were chosen or why Texas seems to escape without more damage. One mention (1) of ham radio.  I'll read the next installment in series
The first in the series was great.This is a mid point and I must say I left wanting and waiting for the third in the series. Dis appointing in that nothing was final.

I enjoyed reading this and the other book, and would like to see one or two more that would conclude the story. I also have trouble figuring out which of the two books is the beginning book. It paints the US government as very simplistic, and our military as if they were 3rd world types. I do not know who this author is but it kept striking me as I read that they do not have much, if any experience, with the US military or government. Just a guess on my part.

I like the first book. I think thoughts spread over to many areas. Focus on a couple. And IMO way way too much filler. Believe they were just trying to gets words to fill a second book quickly.  Action and suspense really drug out.

I became wholeheartedly engaged during the first book (The End: A postapocalyptic Novel) in the series and immediately downloaded this after finishing it. The characters are engaging and reasonably well developed.  The authors descriptions of the environments, events and situations those characters find themselves in are plausible and absorbing. Keeping in mind it's a work of fiction/knowledge that humans can monumentally suck, you should find it at the very least; entertaining.  It's a great read that gives a good idea of the physical and metaphorical dirty feeling the USA would have after a nation wide EMP attack.  Get it, enjoy it. If you're an TEOTWAWKI addict like myself, you won't lament the 5 bucks. If you're a fussy biddy that can't handle a hang nail with a penchant for respiratory problems at the very thought of societal collapse and scary evil guns.... I hear Goodnight Moon is a good read.

I feel there are too many words.  The presidents wife could be cut back.  Also the Mexican connection should be gone.  Words and side stories to fill a book.  The writing is good, and the thought behind the story sound.  Just so much fluff.

The second book in this apocalyptic series is strong. The main characters having been introduced in the first book The End, now find themselves trying to survive not only the disaster caused by the EMP, but the horror of some very sick individuals. A tighter book than the first, I look forward to book three  The New World in 2014

"As her eyes read the words on the page, tears fell from her eyes." Just an example of the clunky writing style that kept interfering with my enjoyment of this book. Too bad, because it was a good story.
Great character development, storyline, research and context. Poor editing is distracting. Looking forward to next in series.  Would you survive?
Was good
G. Michael Hopf has done it again. Fans of The End will not be disappointed. Just wish the third one was already out.
Good!
A bit drawn out and not nearly as good as the first book in the series. Onto the third though and the pace has picked up!
Series much better this book. Government for itself? Logical when it is spelled out for you. I think hoot is right.
I hate to be critical.  This is someone's work.  However, I feel the plot was tired, the characters were not interesting and the writing just ok.  I cannot recommend this book.
The story left much unsaid in a availed attempt to sell the next book. I will not continue with the story.
In addition to very poor editing in this self published series, the plot seems to drag.  This story could be told in fewer books.  Maybe that is why the author is doing this.

I enjoyed The Road in which 5 stars that one earned. This book was terrible each instance is short with a lot of filler. You also seemed angry as the author half way through like you gave up. You can also tell the author was a Marine which is somewhat annoying at times. You started to basically kill everyone off. Do you not like children? You either kill them or make them look like psychopaths. There is one thing that's true. The title The Long Road, is right on. It's going to be a while before you get to the end of this road.

Not a horrible story, or terrible writing, but three stars because its not a whole story. People seem to think that they can haphazardly end somewhere in the middle of a story, having achieved a minimal number of pages, and sell this product as a book. It's not! It is a few chapters of abook. A book requires a plot, beginning middle and an end that provides some sort of resolution.  Even if its part of a series that leaves some questions open there needs to be a story that stands alone...this does not.
Story dragged on in the, middle chapters.  Did not care for ending but will read next book:)  Found many typos!  Misspellings and a few grammatical errors.

With a long road to go with becoming a better writer, I still found this story more cohesive than the last and just ad intriguing.  I'm looking forward to the story of Gordon, Samantha and the rest of the survivors.

ok..so i loved the story line of the first book, but it was so poorly written - i struggled to finish the book.  Don't know if Hopf got help, worked on his writing, or had a ghost writer, but this one is much improved.  I will buy the next book when they come out.
Very Good
Meh
OK.
Did not like this book. IT felt like a re write of the Hunger games. You may get your refund but never your time back.
It could have been such a great story if not for the unnecessary vulgar language. This just goes far beyond the accepted norms for civilized society (We haven't lost that yet by the way.).
I kept reading hoping to find information that would be helpful in teotwawki scenario.  None found.  I wasted my money.  The level of profanity is beyond belief.  F bombs on every page.
none
Same thing no end what happens?
Gruesome book, kids were supplied with guns and kill people, yuk!
